title: Women's freedom of movement still impeded in the Arab world
description: A Human Rights Watch report documents the ongoing limitations that curtail women's freedom of movement within the Arab world, despite notable progress in recent times.

title: Ecuadorians divided over closure of oilfield in Yasuni Park
description: A referendum victory to halt oil production on Block 43 in this biodiversity-rich Amazonian reserve has triggered a debate on potential economic consequences and environmental concerns.

title: Niger: Thousands rally in support of coup as ultimatum for French ambassador looms near
description: Demonstrators gathered near the French military base in the capital Niamey a few hours before the deadline given to France's ambassador in an ultimatum to leave the country.

title: France bans wearing Islamic abaya dresses in schools
description: French Education Minister Gabriel Attal announced the ban citing a violation of French secular laws. The decision has reignited a longstanding debate in France over religious freedom and civil liberties.

title: France breezes past Australia in last match before Rugby World Cup
description: Les Bleus beat Australia 41-17 at the Stade de France, where they will host New Zealand for the opening match of the Rugby World Cup on September 8.

title: The NBA's shady games in China
description: 'Planet NBA' (5/6). Since its creation in 1946, the American basketball league has established itself as both a symbol of America and a global brand. China, a country of basketball fans, is its largest foreign market. But, anxious to preserve its colossal profits, it has yielded on questions concerning Tibet or the Uyghurs.

title: Rochefourchat, the village with a single resident
description: At the end of a small, winding country road, perched at an altitude of 844 meters, this southeastern French village boasts a record for having only one year-round inhabitant.

title: Basketball World Cup: France eliminated after loss to Latvia
description: Latvia took the lead for the first time 30 seconds from the end to win 88-86. Having lost to Canada in its opening match, France has been eliminated after just two games.

title: In Brazil, women are reclaiming samba music
description: As the creators of the country's most famous genre, paradoxically long dominated by men, a talented generation of female performers are re-establishing their place in the history of this art form.

title: Formula 1: Verstappen wins Dutch GP for record-equalling ninth straight victory
description: Max Verstappen equaled Sebastian Vettel's record run of nine consecutive victories in front of his home crowd.

title: Filmmaker Sofia Alaoui: 'I want to challenge the Moroccan middle class'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, the director of 'Animalia' explains why she chose to examine the weight of religion and money in her native Morocco in her first feature film.

title: The quagga mussel, an invasive mollusk threatening the equilibrium of Alpine lakes
description: The invertebrate, whose concentration can reach over 5,000 individuals per square meter, takes nutrients from other species. It has colonized several Alpine lakes.

title: Japan and South Korea torn between Chinese threats, American pressure and weight of colonial history
description: South Korea and Japan signed a trilateral agreement with the United States, despite their painful past and their ambiguous relations with their powerful neighbor, China.

title: Modi calls for African Union to join G20
description: The Indian prime minister said the African bloc should become a permanent member of the group representing 20 major global economies.

title: Prigozhin's death confirmed by Russian authorities after genetic analysis
description: Russia's Investigative Committee said the body of Yevgeny Prigozhin, the Wagner paramilitary group, was among those recovered from the crash of his plane.

title: In Africa, the death of Wagner's boss isn't expected to weaken the group
description: The Russian paramilitary militia that was led by Yevgeny Prigozhin has become indispensable both to authoritarian governments, for whom it represents 'life insurance,' and to the Kremlin.

title: Multiple US Marines killed in Australian aircraft crash
description: Three marines died and 20 were injured during a multination training exercise on the north Australian island of Melville.

title: Israelis opposed to judicial reform take fight to West Bank settlements
description: A demonstration took place in Kiryat Arba, a stronghold of ultranationalist minister Itamar Ben-Gvir.

title: With eyes on 2027, Gérald Darmanin is looking for support and 'space'
description: France's interior minister, who has positioned himself as a likely candidate for the next presidential election, is holding a large rally in his stronghold of Tourcoing on Sunday.

title: Uganda's Victor Kiplangat wins men's world marathon title
description: Kiplangat won in 2:09.12 at the World Athletics Championships in Budapest, as Israel's Teru Meferi and Ethiopia's Leul Gebresilase completed the podium.

title: The summer during which British Conservatives ignored the climate consensus
description: Since the Tories' surprise victory in Uxbridge, attributed to the rejection of a tax on polluting cars in Greater London, Rishi Sunak's government has been exploiting climate-related issues.

title: Niger: Thousands rally in support of coup a day after ordering French ambassador to leave
description: In Niamey on Saturday, citizens gathered to express solidarity with the military leadership and demand sovereign choice as diplomatic tensions with France rise.

title: Researchers cast doubt on the credibility of several carbon offset programs
description: Projects designed to limit greenhouse gas emissions frequently overestimate their actual environmental benefits, according to a study published in 'Science.'

title: The belated transformation of Ukraine's defense industry
description: The sector faces the difficult task of meeting the needs of its armed forces while also combating internal corruption. The war has depleted weapons stockpiles and reforms have been slow to yield results.
